[Reef-pull-request-windows #350](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/350/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
@jsjason Thanks. This looks good. I will merge it.

I understand we have separate jira to do refactor. The problem is with so many new files in one PR, it makes review very hard. First, because too many new files, it makes Git web site super slow. Every single click on the Git web site would take  about 10 seconds for screen to refresh - may be just my slow machine. Second is it is hard to find delta, existing code and new code are all in new files. It is not easy to focus on the real change. We usually prefer smaller PR/separate Jira so that it is easier for code review rather than a big change, then refactor/reduce. May be we can discuss the next step so that to know which way would be better.

Let me call you and discuss.

dhruv

On Wed, Jun 3, 2015 at 12:23 PM, Julia Wang notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I understand we have separate jira to do refactor. The problem is with so
> many new files in one PR, it makes review very hard. First, because too
> many new files, it makes Git web site super slow. Every single click on the
> Git web site would take about 10 seconds for screen to refresh - may be
> just my slow machine. Second is it is hard to find delta, existing code and
> new code are all in new files. It is not easy to focus on the real change.
> We usually prefer smaller PR/separate Jira so that it is easier for code
> review rather than a big change, then refactor/reduce. May be we can
> discuss the next step so that to know which way would be better.
> 
> —

> https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/193#issuecomment-108587077

Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

The mirror of the apache git to here seems to be stalled. Hence, you see the diff between the last time it was mirrored and your code, which include the massive recent PR to change all the license headers. It should be resolved soon and only the 7 changed files will show up here.
This looks good, I'll merge it.
#207 seems to be part of a different approach to this one, right? If so, please close this PR until it is ready to be looked at again.
The sync issues are resolved. However, the PR still shows too many changed files. @dkm2110 can you `rebase` onto current `master`?

@markusweimer @jwang98052 
Seems fine now

[Reef-pull-request-windows #361](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/361/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

@markusweimer @jwang98052 @beysims 

since nobody is using operators at this point of time, I was thinking of removing the non writable one altogether. We know that Writable ones are better. As Julia suggested, in order to maintain history I will make sure that we overwrite the original non writable one and not delete it. Are people okay with that as this will remove unnecessary complications going forward.

Go ahead. This part of the code is not used besides by ourselves, so breaking changes should be fine.

@beysims , @jwang98052 objections?

Ok, We can even change Network service for that purpose. Only
groupcommunication depends on it.
Wake is a little different since NameServer and even REEFMessage depends on
that. We can change that one later.

Dhruv

On Mon, Jun 8, 2015 at 4:42 PM, Markus Weimer notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Go ahead. This part of the code is not used besides by ourselves, so
> breaking changes should be fine.
> 
> @beysims https://github.com/beysims , @jwang98052
> https://github.com/jwang98052 objections?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/193#issuecomment-110172676
> .
I'm pretty sure the `NetworkService` is used by current users of REEF. I wouldn't just overwrite that.

Looks good to me. :+1: 
I will wait for others to take a look.
This adds one new project, `reef-applications`. If we expect additional ones in the future, shouldn't we make `reef-applications` a parent project with `reef-vortex` as a submodule?

@markusweimer I see, so are you suggesting we have a parent `pom.xml`, which can contain common dependencies such as `reef-common`, in `reef-applications` and then each application(e.g. `reef-vortex`) have its own `pom.xml`?

[Reef-pull-request-windows #377](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/377/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

The logic looks good. However, we usually have nested `switch` statements for these checks. See `org.apache.reef.runtime.common.evaluator.task.TaskStatus#isLegal` for an example.

In the name of homogeneous code, can you rephrase it that way?
To test these changes to the Wake clock, I've tested on Linux YARN and Linux Mesos.
